terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Portuguese countryside. Moderate elevation with rolling scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional Portuguese event. Rolling terrain with moderate access, moderate costs, and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: 114 Gravel Race is a regional event in Portugal‚Äîrolling terrain with moderate elevation. The Portuguese countryside is nice and organization is solid, but the moderate access and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid Portuguese rolling gravel race. Worth it for European riders. Not practical for most international riders.

final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in Europe‚Äîyes, it's solid. If you're international‚Äîthere are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better value: regional gravel races. For similar Portuguese terrain: Alentejo Gravel.

logistics.airport: Lisbon (LIS) or Porto (OPO) varies by location
logistics.food: Portugal has full dining options. Stock nutrition.

non_negotiables.why: Portuguese rolling terrain requires sustained effort.

logistics.explanation: Cross-border start in Elvas, Portugal and finish in Badajoz, Spain creates obvious transportation complications with zero guidance provided. No information on nearest airports, parking strategy, or packet pickup locations leaves you guessing on basic race weekend logistics.

length.explanation: 123km hits the sweet spot for gravel racing ‚Äî long enough to matter, short enough to avoid death march territory. Matthew Holmes covered the distance in 3:13:25, while Luc√≠a Gonz√°lez Blanco needed 3:36:14, suggesting 4-6 hours for most riders. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Course features 65% gravel and 35% paved roads through rolling terrain with no major sustained climbs. The steepest section is 6-7% for 1km, with the longest climb being 4km at 4-5% gradient ‚Äî more about endurance than bike handling skills. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: 864m of climbing over 123km is modest for gravel racing, with major climbs concentrated in the mid-course. Starting at 300m and finishing at 150m with gentle rollers throughout keeps the elevation challenge manageable for most riders. Less climbing than The Mid South.

climate.explanation: Historical weather data shows average highs of 62¬∞F and lows of 47¬∞F, with a 46% chance of rain on any given day, and gusts reaching 26 mph. Late March timing in Portugal-Spain border region typically offers mild spring temperatures ideal for long gravel efforts. The low elevation between 150-300m keeps weather moderate without altitude complications. Similar climate challenges to SBT GRVL.

altitude.explanation: Maximum elevation of 300m at the start means sea-level racing with zero altitude impact on performance. Finishing at 150m in Badajoz keeps you firmly in the oxygen-rich zone throughout the course. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds ‚Äî no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: The only UCI gravel race starting in one country and finishing in another delivers cross-border exploration. Rolling through Portuguese dehesas, crossing international borders mid-race, and finishing along the Guadiana river creates exploration vibes.

prestige.explanation: 515 riders from 30 countries registered for 2025, including former MotoGP star Aleix Espargaro and gravel specialists like Annabel Fisher and Freddy Ovett. UCI Gravel World Series qualification adds legitimacy despite being one of 40+ qualifier events. As Aleix Espargar√≥ puts it: "Riding is fun! Despite having little technique with the gravel bike and premiering the Checkmate [Trek gravel bike] yesterday, I enjoyed it a lot and I have good legs to finish seventh overall in my f..."

race_quality.explanation: Three feed zones at km 30, 55, and 93 show basic organization, but course specs remain inconsistent ‚Äî UCI lists 123km/864m while race website claims 137km/1,370m. Elite finish margins of 1 second (men) and 21 seconds (women) suggest proper competitive execution.

experience.explanation: Starting at UNESCO World Heritage fortifications in Elvas and finishing at Guadiana Park in historic Badajoz creates cultural depth. The course passes through 'seemingly untouched nature reserves and farmed pastures' connecting medieval Portuguese and Spanish heritage sites.

community.explanation: Being part of the UCI series means qualifying opportunities for age-group riders chasing World Championships spots. The Portugal-Spain border theme creates natural camaraderie around the unique geography.

field_depth.explanation: Matthew Holmes used road professional experience to edge Jose Maria Sanchez Ruiz by one second after 3:13:25. The presence of former pros and gravel specialists like Annabel Fisher elevates competition beyond typical amateur fields. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100. As Jorge Padrones puts it: "The first part of the course was very fast and seemed to go always downhill which made the first hour fly by."

value.explanation: ‚Ç¨50-70 tiered entry fees are reasonable for a UCI-sanctioned event with World Championship qualifying opportunities. The cross-border logistics complexity and cultural heritage venues justify the cost for serious age-group competitors chasing qualification spots.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs ‚Ç¨50-80. Cross-border logistics between Elvas and Badajoz create transportation headaches with no clear accommodation guidance provided. You're dealing with two countries and zero information on parking or packet pickup locations beyond the reasonable race entry fees. Higher total cost than Badlands.

citations.label: ryanmtb.substack.com: Keegan Swenson Predicts Fast Tactical

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners

videos.title: 114 GRAVEL RACE - REEL RESUMEN OFICIAL
videos.description:
ESP...114 Gravel Race prueba @ucigravelworldseries se despide por todo lo alto, con una emocionante salida en la ciudad portuguesa de @municipioelvas y una llegada apote√≥sica en la Ciudad espa√±ola de @aytobadajoz , la prueba m√°s internacional. 
Gracias a todos los que nos hab√©is acompa√±ado en este gran d√≠a de ciclismo y enhorabuena a todos los clasificados para el Campeonato del mundo.
nos vemos en 2026!!!
ENG...The 114th Gravel Race @ucigravelworldseries bids farewell in style, with an exciting start in the Portuguese city of @municipioelvas and a spectacular finish in the Spanish city of @aytobadajoz , the most international event of its kind. Thank you to everyone who joined us on this great day of cycling, and congratulations to all those who qualified for the World Championship. See you in 2026!!!
POR...Prova 114 Gravel Race @ucigravelworldseries despede-se em grande estilo, com uma partida emocionante na cidade portuguesa de @municipioelvas e uma tremenda chegada √† cidade espanhola de @aytobadajoz , a prova mais internacional. Obrigado a todos que se juntaram a n√≥s neste grande dia do ciclismo e parab√©ns a todos os classificados para o Campeonato do Mundo. Nos vemos em 2026!!!

videos.title: GRAVEL EN BADAJOZ / CARRERA 114 GRAVEL UCI

rider_intel.search_text: The provided transcript from the 114 Gravel Race in Portugal contains primarily music, foreign speech, and fragmented audio that does not yield extractable race intelligence. The video appears to be from race day coverage but lacks coherent discussion of course features, terrain conditions, or race-specific advice that would be useful for future participants. No specific information about the 70-mile course, 4000 feet of elevation, challenging sections, surface conditions, or gear recommendations can be determined from this transcript. Riders seeking actionable intelligence about this Portuguese gravel race would need additional sources with clearer commentary about the course characteristics, pacing strategies, or logistical considerations.
